title: Quiz: FQE Undated Past Paper
description: Undated Final Qualifying Examination paper covering medical history, ethics, and filing systems.

questions.question: Health records are necessary for the practice of ________ as medications are for effective treatment.
questions.explanation: Records are an integral tool for the practice of medicine.

questions.question: The physician who made use of health records in Egypt was
questions.explanation: Imhotep is the first recorded physician in history (Ancient Egypt) known for systematic medical records.

questions.question: Hippocrates was known for the below mentioned except one
questions.explanation: Grand Vizier is a political title (typically Ottoman or Ancient Egyptian/Imhotep). Hippocrates was Greek.
questions.hint: Which title is political, not medical?

questions.question: "Whatsoever in my practice... I shall see or hear... I shall keep silence..." This originated from
questions.explanation: This is a quote from the Hippocratic Oath regarding confidentiality.
questions.hint: The Father of Medicine wrote this.

questions.question: ________ are the basic concepts of fundamental principles of decent human conduct
questions.explanation: Ethics deals with moral principles and decent conduct in a profession.
questions.hint: What governs right and wrong in a job?

questions.question: The principles of medical records professional acknowledges the undermentioned except

options.text: Respects the dignity of each client/patient
Refuses to participate and to conceal the legal or ethical acts
Strives to improve personal competence and quality of service
Demonstrate the behavior that reflects integrity

questions.explanation: The principle is to refuse to conceal *illegal* or *unethical* acts. Option B incorrectly suggests refusing to conceal legal/ethical acts.
questions.hint: Read carefully: should you conceal legal acts?

questions.question: The section where when patient arrives in health care facility is greeted and welcomed to the hospital is
questions.explanation: Reception is the point of greeting.

questions.question: The medical records can serve the below mentioned apart from one

options.text: To provide a means of communication amongst the health care providers
To serve as an inference in continuity of patient care
To provide documentary evidence of care given in the facility
To provide clinical and administrative data

questions.explanation: Records serve as a *direct tool* for continuity, not merely an 'inference'.
questions.hint: Which word sounds vague compared to 'communication' or 'evidence'?

questions.question: A trained health records personnel should have the following qualities. All the qualities match their definition apart from one

options.text: Discretion - ability to use knowledge to make decisions
Calmness - not being emotional in emergency

questions.explanation: Integrity means Honesty/Moral uprightness, not humility.

questions.question: There are different types of health records. Which one is not a category?
questions.explanation: 'Patient records' is the general term for all of them.

questions.question: Diagnostic records

options.text: Include notes on radiography, pathology and other investigation
Are usually initiated by consultative forms

questions.explanation: Diagnostic records contain investigation results like X-rays and labs.

questions.question: It is at the ________ that new patients/client receives their first impression of the institution values
questions.explanation: First impressions happen at Reception.

questions.question: First impressions have a ... effect
questions.explanation: A common saying: First impressions have a lasting effect.

questions.question: The primary aim of patient registration is to ensure that any current ________ And future health care records are associated with the correct patient
questions.explanation: Registration links Past (Previous), Present, and Future records.

questions.question: In the process of initiating a patient record the following details must appear except which one
questions.explanation: Address is demographic data, but Name, Date, and Sex are critical identifiers on clinical sheets.

questions.question: The ________ system is a health records system in which health records notes relating to one patient are contained in one case folder
questions.explanation: Unit system = One patient, One folder.

questions.question: Duplication in the use of unit numbers can be prevented by the below mentioned except

options.text: By not giving the same number to two patients
Not giving the same patient more than two numbers
Cross checking through the master patient index
Either by not giving the two numbers to two patients

questions.explanation: The rule is not to give MORE than ONE number. Giving 'not more than two' implies two is okay, which is false.
questions.hint: How many numbers should a patient have? Only one.

questions.question: Cards may be filed 'blind' in drawers or filed one behind the other in an upright position in which of the following equipment
questions.explanation: Blind filing refers to vertical drawer filing where you can't see the card face until opening.

questions.question: The plan for destruction process for medical records should comprise the following ways of destruction. Choose one that is not clearly explained

options.text: Burning - carrying out any process that makes it impossible to produce the information in a transferring or delivery ownership

questions.explanation: The definition for 'Burning' given here is vague and incoherent ('delivery ownership').

questions.question: Which of the following documents in the patient file is used to carry out diagnostic coding?
questions.explanation: The Discharge Summary contains the final diagnosis.

questions.question: ________ involves comparing a set of products or services against the best that can be found within the relevant industry sector
questions.explanation: Benchmarking is comparing against the best.

questions.question: Quality assessment refers to

options.text: A system designed to monitor and evaluate quality issues within a care facility

questions.explanation: Quality Assessment is the monitoring and evaluation system.

questions.question: Widespread implementation of electronic medical records has a perceived barrier, which one of the following is it
questions.explanation: Compatibility (Interoperability) is a technical barrier.

questions.question: Informal admission refers to

options.text: Patient is admitted voluntarily... reference to Mental Health Act
A patient is admitted without legal or other formalities and the hospital has no right to detain him in the hospital against his will
A patient is admitted with legal formalities...

questions.explanation: Informal = Voluntary, no detention rights.

questions.question: One of the below mentioned statements is not true about subpoena

options.text: Is the term used for a legal order to produce records to a court
It is usually addressed to 'the custodian of medical records'
If a subpoena or court order is served it must not be obeyed
It directs the person to appear in a given court with the records

questions.explanation: A subpoena MUST be obeyed.

questions.question: Which of the following is used to prove the condition of a patient on admission or attendance at a hospital and the history of the assault related by the patient
questions.explanation: In assault cases, the record is primary evidence of condition.

questions.question: When considering a retention policy, the hospital must consider the following except

options.text: Patients full name and date of birth
The volume of medical research undertaken by hospital staff
Cost involved in finding inactive filing space

questions.explanation: Policy is based on factors like cost and research, not individual patient names.
questions.hint: Which is specific patient data rather than a general policy factor?

questions.question: If a request is made for the release of information the request should contain the following apart from one

options.text: Full name of patient, address and date of birth
Name of person/persons or institution requesting information
Purpose and need of the information

questions.explanation: The request asks FOR the treatment info; it doesn't contain it (unless verifying).
questions.hint: What is the request *asking for* vs containing?

questions.question: Membership of the medical record committee should consist of the below mentioned except

options.text: The representative of the doctors from both medicine and surgery

questions.explanation: Patients are generally not on the technical Medical Records Committee.

questions.question: One of the following is an advantage of personal tracer card

options.text: It is recommended only for large libraries
There is no object in place of the file to show where the record was before extraction/retrieval
No transposition of numbers since the number created permanently on the card

questions.explanation: Personal tracers are pre-printed, avoiding numbering errors.

questions.question: The common tracer card has the following information written on it except
questions.explanation: Date of Birth is not needed for temporary location tracking.
questions.hint: Which is not needed to track location?

questions.question: Auxiliary equipment includes the below mentioned except
questions.explanation: Dividers are supplies, not auxiliary equipment.
questions.hint: Which one goes inside the file drawer?

questions.question: This is the most economical filing method as far as space is concerned of shelves
questions.explanation: Mobile racking saves the most space.

questions.question: The following are checks to be made on the waiting lists except
questions.explanation: Administrative checks don't usually assess clinical quality.

questions.question: These are different types of health records indices used and maintained in a health records department they include the following except
questions.explanation: Waiting list is a register, not a research index.

questions.question: All listed below are ways of conveying information to the waiting list except
questions.explanation: You don't create a card for *every* patient, only those needing admission.

questions.question: Putting records in order before filing is something referred to as
questions.explanation: Sorting precedes filing.

questions.question: Which one of the following is not a quality of a health records and information officer
questions.explanation: Generosity is not a core professional quality.

questions.question: Which one of the following is not a permanent record?
questions.explanation: Maternity records are patient files (eventually destroyed). Registers are permanent.
questions.hint: Which one is a case file, not a register?

questions.question: Case records can be described as

options.text: Records initiated for patients who get admitted into the wards and attends consultative clinics
Patient who continuously attend the consultant clinics
The person taking in the information
The range of documents to be included in the case record

questions.explanation: Case records cover both inpatient and outpatient episodes.

questions.question: State the eight core capabilities that electronic medical records should possess (IOM)
questions.explanation:
8 Core Capabilities (IOM):

  1. Health Information and Data
  2. Result Management
  3. Order Entry/Management
  4. Decision Support
  5. Electronic Communication
  6. Patient Support
  7. Administrative Processes
  8. Reporting/Population Health

questions.question: Highlight the eight instances in which medical records are used as evidence
questions.explanation:
Used as Evidence in:

  1. Personal Injury Claims
  2. Malpractice suits
  3. Workmen's Compensation
  4. Insurance Claims
  5. Criminal Cases
  6. Will disputes (Capacity)
  7. Custody Battles
  8. Disability assessments

questions.question: State the functions of the bed bureau
questions.explanation:
Bed Bureau Functions:

  1. Maintain bed occupancy records
  2. Arrange emergency admissions
  3. Coordinate transfers
  4. Provide bed statistics
  5. Liaise with wards

questions.question: State the fundamental requirements of a filing system
questions.explanation:
Requirements:

  • Accessibility
  • Simplicity
  • Economy
  • Suitability
  • Safety
  • Elasticity
questions.hint: What makes a filing system good?

questions.question: State 4 purposes of appointment/scheduling
questions.explanation:
Purposes:

  1. Reduce waiting time
  2. Allow preparation (pull files)
  3. Regulate workload
  4. Ensure even distribution

questions.question: State 5 advantages of the secretarial pool system
questions.explanation:
Advantages:

  1. Continuity of work
  2. Standardization
  3. Economy
  4. Even Workload
  5. Flexibility

questions.question: State at least eight qualities of an appraiser
questions.explanation:
Qualities:

  1. Good judgment
  2. Knowledge of history
  3. Legal knowledge
  4. Research understanding
  5. Experience
  6. Objectivity
  7. Integrity
  8. Attention to detail
questions.hint: Someone who decides what records to keep.

questions.question: State 4 advantages of Microforms
questions.explanation:
Advantages:

  1. Space Saving
  2. Preservation/Durability
  3. Security (Backup)
  4. Easy Distribution

questions.question: Explain the procedures of establishing a new Health Records Department (Long Answer)
questions.explanation:
Phases:

  1. Definition (Feasibility): Assess needs, scope, budget.
  2. Brief Phase: Detailed specs, location, space calc.
  3. Design Phase: Layout, safety, furniture.
  4. Construction & Commissioning: Supervision, fitting out, staffing, migration.
